column10: Car did not stop for pedestrian & dog in crosswalk.

I was crossing S. Arlington Mill Dr. from north to south at Campbell St. I had reached the median. When I set my foot into the second half of the crosswalk, cars in both lanes traveling west on S. Arlington Mill Dr. drove right in front of me.
column21: This happens all the time. There need to be flashing yellow lights here just says there are 0.2 mile up the road at Arlington Mill Drive and South Oxford. PLEASE!!!

column10: I was a pedestrian in a crosswalk over S. Arlington Mill Dr. from the north to the south side at Campbell Avenue. While in the middle of the crosswalk over the westbound lane a car drove right behind me while I was still in the crosswalk not having reached even the median strip. It did not even slow down so may not have even seen me. Similar incidents happen ALL the time. There are SO many pedestrians crossing here, especially because of the Shirlington retail/restaurants, brewery and the dog park. I’ve lived in the neighborhood since 2016 and it has gotten worse. Drivers, especially those in the westbound lane (where the road curves preceding the crosswalk), are focused on the traffic signal at S. Arlington Mill Dr. and “Driveway” such that the crosswalk does NOT register. For pedestrian safety before someone gets seriously injured, we need flashing lights installed here !!!! PLEASE!!!!
column21:
PLEASE let’s beg the county to install yellow flashing lights here. This Crosswalk is preceded by a curvature in the road on the westbound side and is SO much more heavily used than the Xwalk 0.1 mile down the street at Windgate (around 2600 S Arlington Mill Dr),
where a flashing signal was installed. If these things happen to me as often as they do, dangerous events are occurring with incredible frequency.
column26: 2720 S. Arlington Mill Dr. #209 Arlington VA 22206

column10: A Red BMW sedan was speeding as my partner and I were in the crosswalk and stopped less than a foot away from my partner, almost hitting my dog and continued speeding

Drivers heading south on Shirlington Rd. do not yield to drivers coming around the loop (I was trying to get onto 395 South). Have almost been hit here at least once a month. People in the neighborhood refer to this as the ""death circle"" since it is so dangerous. Need to have a stop light or rumble strips for drivers going south on Shirlington Rd as then approach this intersection - they often ignore the stop/yield sign that is there.
column21: There is a yield sign that clearly says to yield to traffic in the circle but drivers fail to do so.

column10: I live by the intersection of S. Four Mile Run Drive and Oakland. Even with the crosswalk lights, cars will still drive by pedestrians even when the lights are flashing, and frequently drive over the speed limit. My mother on her way to pick up her car from the mechanic’s place , pressed the button before crossing and halfway through the crosswalk a car with Maryland tags drove right past her without even slowing down for a bit.
column34: Sign posted around Heatherlee condominium area

column10: A driver stopped at this intersection (four-way stop) but did not notice that my dog and I had already been in the crosswalk before they approached the stop sign. They proceeded through the crosswalk, nearly hitting me and my dog.
column21: It was raining, but that should not have impacted the driver’s visibility as I was wearing bright colors and had waved at the car to grab the driver’s attention.
